Articles.Content:
Hello!

I made flying drone that can fly infinitely and its simple!

1 x Probodobodyne OKTO2

1 x Thermoelectric generator

2 x Large ASAS module

8 x Delta-Deluxe winglet with very high attack of angle

Just rotate the drone and it lifts (pressing E in this case)
Thats so wierd. The other day i was designing exactly the same thing, which looked pretty much like this, although I couldn't get it off the ground very easily. Well done!

This works through the help of the infiniglide bug here

Basically, in ksp flight model, control surfaces work by generating a slight amount of thrust when you move them, instead of fighting against the air flow like in real life , so basically, here, especially with such a high angle of incidence (enough angle to prevent the winglets from generating lift through rotation) the deluxe winglets control surface 'thrust' your drone into the air
infiniglide bug, Is a bug. I manage to build this "Bug" to LKO (Lower Kerbin Orbit). Yes. LKO. but at the end. I just scrap it...cause it is "Bug" in the game.
Its like a heli! Ahh KSP physics...I mean bugs.
He used 2 ASA'S and a probe body. Adding more reaction wheels makes it rotate faster thus generating more lift. Our designs usually just had a small probe body.
It doesn't fly for me. Your'e creation is a haxed thang.
